fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45171].
  {panel}

Currently the time tracking reports page states:
{quote}To generate a Time Tracking Report:

Navigate to the desired project.
Choose Summary (tab) > Reports section > Time Tracking Report. {quote} 

This is no longer correct in JIRA 6.4. To generate a Time Tracking Report, you must:
Navigate to the desired project.
Choose Reports (bar chart tab) > Forecast &management section > Time Tracking Report

The images on this page are also from an older version of JIRA and should be updated.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Reports Documentation Outdated

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When navigating to the What's New option within JIRA, the screen pops up points to broken link. The link in 6.3.10 points to {{https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-063/whatsnew/}} which redirects to a page that doesn't exist. The current Whats New page is found at {{https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/whats-new}}. This functionality has been removed as of 6.4.1 

On version 6.3.15 What's New window navigating to below links which are not available:
* https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=GTM-MLBVG3&l=dataLayer
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/whatsnew/iframe?od=false&a=true&pa=true

h2. Steps To Reproduce
- Pull up any JIRA system prior to 6.4 
- Select the Question Mark Icon at the top right
- From the dropdown select What's New

h2. Actual behavior 
User encounters Page Not Found or Oops. We are having trouble... as attached on screenshots 
!what_new_error.JPG|thumbnail!  !what_new_error2.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: What's New In JIRA Link Broken in JIRA

fields.description:
*Problem*
When copying text from an HTML email in Microsoft Outlook to a JIRA rich text editor field (e.g,. description/comment fields), the carriage returns and formatting (e.g., bold, links, etc) are removed.

*Expected Behavior*
Ideally, it would preserve the carriage returns and all formatting. If that's not easily possible, retaining the carriage returns when pasting would be great because it would save us a lot of time reformatting the content.

*Environment*
* Microsoft Windows 7 Professional 64-bit
* Microsoft Office 2013
* Firefox 40
* Internet Explorer 11.0.9600.17959

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Open Outlook
# View an HTML email
# Copy the contents of the email and paste into the JIRA description field
# The carriage returns and formatting will be lost

I have also tested this on a Mac and this does not occur when copying text from an HTML email in Outlook 2016 that's part of Office 2016 for Mac. JIRA will retain the carriage returns, but remove the formatting. I tested this in Google Chrome 44.0..2403.157 (64-bit) and Firefox 40.0.3 on the Mac.
fields.summary: Copying and pasting text from a Microsoft Outlook HTML email to a rich text editor field in JIRA does not preserve carriage returns

Issue filters on Project issues page shows a set of predefined filtes and are not configurable. See screenshot below:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45166].
  {panel}

h5. Current Behaviour
* New Project Navigation no longer has Version Issue Summary

h5. Feature Request
* Add Version Issue Summary in the New Project Navigation 

7.0.0-OD-02-259

{panel:title=Example Use Case|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1  |bgColor=#FFFFCE  }
By removing this screen from JIRA 7, you've made it difficult to:

a) See how many open tickets are assigned to each developer in a particular version (alternative: filter & count, or use a dashboard widget which needs to be changed every version, both cumbersome)
b) Click to the queue of a particular developer for a particular version (alternative: use issue summary navigator; 4-5 clicks instead of 2)

It seems a completely unnecessary change; why was it removed?
{panel}
fields.summary: Add Version Issue Summary in the New Project Navigation

fields.description:
I have 
- Windows 10 
- Microsoft Edge 20.10240.16384.0
- Jira v6.2.5

When trying to attach a file to ticket:
1. Choose More... -> Attach Files
2. Choose Browse
3. Select the file and click "OK"

...nothing happens.

When clicking "Attach", the window throws error "Please indicate the file you wish to upload"

I can confirm that IE 11.0.10240.16431 with Windows 10 works ok.
fields.summary: Unable to attach file with Windows 10 Microsoft Edge

fields.description:
Hello,

While using the gadget "Road Map", one of our project doesn't show any issue although it contains issues. We already check on the web and the problem could be linked to the fact that this project has the same name than another project key. It was the case then we updated this project key, restart jira and re-index but nothing changes.
Do we need to perform other actions ? Or do you have another solution ?

Thanks
fields.summary: No issue displays for Gadget 'Road Map'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45163].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Non-required custom field prompted when moving an issue.

As per documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Moving+an+Issue
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/moving-an-issue-185729549.html

{quote}Custom Fields — If you have defined required custom fields for your issue, which do not exist in your target project, you must set values for them. You will only be prompted to change the enter values for required custom fields in the target project, that are missing values. If you wish to change the existing values for other fields on your issue, you can do this after the move is complete.{quote}

*Note* 
Target project is configured to have the custom field but not required.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not prompt non-required custom field when moving an issue.
fields.summary: Moving an Issue - Non-required custom field prompted when moving an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an email is sent from JIRA, atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log file is not created even the setting is set to ON in [Logging and Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling]. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure an outgoing mail server.
# Setup the default notification scheme.
# Trigger an action that will send email from JIRA to the user, such as assigning issue.
# Navigate to JIRA_HOME/log, find for atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log file.

h3. Expected Results
atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log file is created.

h3. Actual Results
There is no atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log file at JIRA_HOME/log.
 
h3.Workaround
Turn on DEBUG for outgoing mail at [Logging and Profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling].
fields.summary: atlassian-jira-outgoing-mail.log file is not created.

fields.description: When adding a custom field to JIRA, help text as well as an example image are shown for each custom field type.  The example shown for the URL custom field shows "www.jira.com" which fails validation for a URL field as it has no protocol.  This should be updated to "http://www.jira.com".
fields.summary: URL custom field type example shows a link that won't pass validation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When opening pages in JIRA such as the dashboard or issues, the initial GET on the Dashboard.jspa or the issue can take considerable periods of time, for example greater than 10s.

When there is a change in the Crowd directory (for example, logging in, synchronisation and so on), the Add-on Manager (UPM) clears the agent count cache. As a result of this when code references this cache it must be rebuilt each time. This can cause significant performance problems in JIRA as the construction of pages references Service Desk code to determine which URLs should be added.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a large instance with JIRA Service Desk and a large number of users.
# Load a page.
# Make a change to a user in Crowd (such as logging in).
# Reload the page.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads quickly.

h3. Actual Results

Page loads, such as GET on a issue or dashboard can take greater than 10s.

h3. Fix

Upgrading the Add-on Manager (UPM) to 2.18.5 or higher will resolve this problem. This can be done by browsing to the Manage Add-ons page and selecting upgrade.

h3. Verification

Taking thread dumps as per [Generate a Thread Dump|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] during periods of slow responsiveness in JIRA will display threads similar to the ones below. An easy way to parse them to find if this is a problem can be searching for the following:

{noformat}
grep -c GlobalPermissionUserCountCacheImpl.resetAll *
thread_dump_20150831_01.txt:2
thread_dump_20150831_02.txt:11
thread_dump_20150831_03.txt:12
thread_dump_20150831_04.txt:2
thread_dump_20150831_05.txt:11
thread_dump_20150831_06.txt:2
thread_dump_20150831_07.txt:3
thread_dump_20150831_08.txt:8
{noformat}

fields.description: Through the UI JIRA has a maximum limit of 254 characters for single line text custom fields.  Using the Jira Suite Utilities post-function 'Update Custom Field' I was able to set a single line text field to 255 characters.  Trying to subsequently edit the same 255-character-long field value through the UI yielded slightly different behavior for different browsers.  In Chrome you could delete the final character but not restore it (as the 254 character limit was still imposed).  In Firefox you could not delete the final character until you had deleted any other character to reduce the field size below 255.
fields.summary: Single Line Text Field is limited to 254 chars in the UI but 255 chars if set programatically

Issue:

Unable to paste text into the Summary field in Firefox 40 on Windows 7 Using JIRA 7.0

Details:

Our JIRA Project uses JIRA 7.0.0 and if I try to paste text into the subject field using CTRL-V to paste, it doesn't work, nothing happens. I am able to right click into the field and select paste, and that works, and I am able to use CTRL-V to paste into the description field, that works as well. I noticed this using a Windows 7 Machine and Firefox 40.0.3. Interestingly enough, this issue does not happen on your JIRA project, but it looks like you are running 6.5 while we are running 7.0. I can confirm that using CTRL-V to paste works in our JIRA project in Chrome, but since I use Firefox as my main web browser for work, this is a minor inconvenience.
fields.summary: Unable to paste text into the Summary field in Firefox 40 on Windows 7 Using JIRA 7.0 using CTRL-V

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In our [Connecting to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory] documentation, we have the following description for the *Default Group Memberships*: 
{quote}
The first time a user logs in, their group memberships will be checked. If the user does not belong to the specified group(s), their username will be added to the group(s). If a group does not yet exist, it will be added locally. On subsequent logins, the username will not be added automatically to any groups. This change in behaviour allows users to be removed from automatically-added groups. In Confluence 3.5 and 3.5.1, they would be re-added upon next login. 
{quote}

However, if the first login attempt for the user is not successful (e.g. typing the wrong pass), then the user will never be able to login unless an admin updates the user group membership.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect JIRA to an LDAP server as per [Connecting to an LDAP Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory], using the settings below:
#* LDAP Permissions: *Read Only, with Local Groups*
#* Default Group Memberships: *jira-users*
# After the directory is synchronized, try to login with an LDAP user, but typing the wrong password.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to authenticate normally so that after the first login it is added to the {{jira-users}} group.

h3. Actual Results
Any subsequent login (even with the right password) will fail.

h3.Workaround
* If this problem has happened only with small number of users, the easiest way to resolve it is by logging in as an JIRA System Administrator and manually add the users to the {{jira-users}} group.
* If this problem is affecting several users, you may consider one of the options below:
*# *Manage JIRA access on LDAP / Active Directory directly* by creating a group similar to the {{jira-users}} group there and adding all relevant users to these groups.
*# *Creating a new User Directory* so that the users on the new directory won't have any login information and hence would be added to the {{jira-users}} on their first login.
fields.summary: Default Group Membership does not work if the first login attempt is unsuccessful

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On moving Issue to another project, JIRA doesn't check the permission for Assignable User. JIRA should not fill that Assignee field during moving an issue, if the former assignee doesn't have  *Assignable User* in project B.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue in projectA
# Give UserA *Assignable User* permission for projectA
# Assign the created issue in projectA to UserA
# Create projectB
# Move Issue from projectA to projectB

h3. Expected Results
Assignee field should be left blank as they original assignee doesn't have permission in projectB.

h3. Actual Results
The original assignee is still assigned the issue in projectB although he doesn't have *Assignable User* permission in projectB

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45042].
  {panel}


h2. Problem Definition
* The *'Configure Fields'* button which exist in the 'Create Issue Pop Up Screen' is not available in the 'Create Issue Screen that is access by URL'. This seems to be a missing functionality at the moment, and are not configurable at the moment.
* Inconsistency of configuration as if through Create Issue Screen Popup, user have configured custom-fields-visibility, when access the create issue screen from a URL link will remove this custom-fields-visibility setup
* To access the URL : https://<your jira URL>/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=1234&issuetype=6 , change PID with appropriate project ID and issue type.
!URL_access_createissue_popup1.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue_popup.png|thumbnail!
!URL_access_createissue.png|thumbnail!

{quote}
This is needed in order to retain the user preference for the fields on the Create Issue Screen. When we try to create issue using link, Jira looses the custom field preference by the user on the create issue screen and displays all the fields on the screen. Which is annoying for the users who do not want to see all the fileds or all the fields are not useful for users and they have hidden those fileds from screen. It is not necessary to have "Configure Field" button on the screen while creating an issue from link, but Jira must retain the field preference and should only show the fileds which are selected by user through Configure Fields option.
{quote}


h2. Suggested Solution
* To introduce this button in the 'Create Issue Screen that is access by URL' so that consistency can be achieved here.
* To ensure the user preference for the fields on the Create Issue Screen via Screen Popup coexist on the Create Issue Screen via URL
fields.summary: To introduce Configure Fields (Custom field preference) in Create Issue Screen via URL

h3. Summary
After installing the Chinese JIRA Translation Pack, and setting the default language to Chinese, tooltips on dates show escape sequences instead of the expected Chinese characters when viewing an issue.

h3. Environment
This was Observed from a Desktop running in English (Australian Locale) with the default language or JIRA set to Chinese

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Chinese Language Pack into JIRA
# Set language to Chinese
# Hover over a Date to show a tooltip when viewing an issue.

h3. Expected Results
The tooltip should show the locale specific date, without the escaped character sequences.

h3. Actual Results
As per the attached screenshot, the tooltip shows escaped sequences of the Chinese characters.

h3. Notes
Translations are provided by customers and external entities, and are not fully supported by Atlassian. For more information please see: [https://translations.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Date Tooltip for Chinese & Russian Dates Show Escape Sequences

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

Can not switch to basic issue navigator view when an upper case name is entered in a JQL query.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new user as "NONADMIN"
# Search for the username using the following JQL query:
{code}
assignee = NONADMIN
{code}
# Can't switch back to Basic mode:
!basic-mode.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results.

You are able to switch to Basic mode.

h3. Actual Results.

You are prevented from switching into Basic mode.

h3. Notes

The general issue is that queries for assigne="UPPER_CASE_USER_NAME" trick the issue navigator into thinking it is a complex query. You can reproduce this issue with any username.

h3. Workaround

You can simply type

{code}
assignee = nonadmin
{code}

and you should get equivalent results. Username searches are case-insensitive.
fields.summary: Can't switch to JQL Basic mode when username is uppercase

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Find New Add-ons page not showing buttons for already-licensed (but not installed) add-on

h3. Environment
UPM version 2.19.x 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Paid plugin
# Add license
# Uninstall plugin
# Go to 'Find new add-ons' and check any already-licensed (but not installed) addon (eg: <JIRA_URL>/plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/atlassian)

h3. Expected Results
You get action buttons for it
!UPM_bug1.png!

h3. Actual Results
You get *no* action buttons
!UPM_bug2.png!

h3. Notes
Original UPM bug: [UPM-3238|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/projects/UPM/issues/UPM-3238]

h3.Workaround
Choose one of following 
* Downgrade UPM version to any version below 2.19.1 (Not possible for JIRA 6.4.10/6.4.11)
* Install paid plugin manually
* Delete license information from database
fields.summary: UPM - Find New Add-ons page not showing buttons for already-licensed (but not installed) add-on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45015].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the [Search Request View|https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/jira/search-request-view.html] module returns a 403 Forbidden error when attempting to export more than 1000 issues. 

The issue number export limitation is well known per [CLOUD-6544|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CLOUD-6544]. However, plug-ins developed to leverage this module return a 403 when a user is trying to export a search with more than 1000 issues with plug-in specific exporting options created with the search request view module. The 403 error may cause the user to assume the plug-in has failed in some way rather than JIRA enforcing a documented limitation.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if JIRA could send the plug-in the control and, as long as the maxIssues parameter is set for the search request view module, the issue export restriction can be managed.
fields.summary: Improve Error Handling for Search Request View Module

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Notifications are not being sent for certain changes made in JIRA even when 
* notifications are turned on
* notifications work for issue assigned, created etc.
* and the users profile is set to 'Notify Me' of own changes

Changes not being notified for:
* Comment on an issue
* Edit an issue
* If the user is not already a watcher, reporter, assignee of the issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a notification scheme for the project
# Set the profile settings to 'Notify Me'
# Comment on an issue where the user is not an assignee, reporter or watcher
# No email will be received
# Edit the description of an issue where the user is not an assignee, reporter or watcher
# No email will be received
# Change the status of an issue where the user is not an assignee, reporter or watcher
# No email will be received

h3. Expected Results
The user should be notified of their own changes by email.
h3. Actual Results
No email is received.
 
h3.Workaround
The user must assign themselves as a watcher prior to making changes to receive notifications for comments.
fields.summary: In JIRA users are not notified of certain changes when set to Notify Me

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44986].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of the release of JIRA 7, support for Internet Explorer 9 has been [End-of-Lifed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-201502IE9] and is [no longer supported|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/supported-browsers-744721663.html].

Customers who use IE9 are unable to navigate to any part of their JIRA Instance and are redirected back to the JIRA Dashboard

Customers in moderated environments do not have the ability to install an alternative browser (Chrome, Firefox, or Safari) nor the ability to upgrade to a supported version of Internet Explorer (10 or 11)

h3. Suggested Solution
Continued support for IE9 until it is [End-of-Lifed by Microsoft|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/search?sort=PN&alpha=internet%20explorer] 
 
h3. Workaround 
Install one of the supported web browser
|Microsoft Internet Explorer (Windows)|(/) Versions 10, 11|
|Mozilla Firefox (all platforms)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
|Google Chrome (Windows and Mac)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
|Safari (Mac)|(/) Latest stable version supported|
fields.summary: Support for Internet Explorer 9 in JIRA 7

# Go to Field Configurations
# Hide Priority Field
# Go to a project using the field configuration
# See error message and no issues displayed

h3. Expected Results
Issues should still display

h3. Actual Results
No error is shown in the JIRA log.

Error message that appears
{noformat}
The JIRA server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{noformat}

What console displays:
{noformat}
/rest/issueNav/1/issueTable Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)
batch.js:216 DEPRECATED - Persistent: false has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release. 
     at showMsg (https://d1ixbz5qgnvms3.cloudfront.net/instance.atlassian.net/s/c5c95a3c91…_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:2531:1465)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Go to Field Configuration and change Priority or Resolution to *Show*
or
Change the "Order by" option to a visible field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using JIRA's CSV Import feature, when user import a CSV file with *default time tracking time set to anything other than minutes*, JIRA displays wrong value for the estimated time. This issue can't be reproduced if the the CSV import is done using the External import feature.

Exemple:
(CSV) Original Estimate = 2400 seconds
(JIRA) Original Estimate = 1 hours
(the correct value on JIRA would be 1.5 hours)

h3. Workaround

Importing for External Import function will import the CSV file with right time tracking value.
fields.summary: atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin:bulkCreateCsv - Rounding Original Estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44969].
  {panel}

h5. Problem definition
Currently JIRA projects can only have a single key associated to it. This is undesirable on certain circumstances.

h5. Suggestion
The idea is to provide aliases for project keys. For instance assume you have the process of having two distinct projects in JIRA for a single project "Foo". One for development and one after the project was released:

Project key: FOO (for released builds)
Project key: FOODEV (for development builds)

Before the project goes live, you only set-up the FOODEV project in JIRA.

It would be great if you could specify a project key alias to FOODEV called FOO which can then be used to look-up FOODEV issues as long as the alias is active.
At the point the project is released you can then remove the alias and add a FOO-project.

The net outcome is that all your employees will always work with the "FOO" project key and it will automatically use the FOODEV-project during the early development phase while later it will automatically use the FOO-project.

No more need to rectify the long project key names for administrators.
fields.summary: Provide project key aliasing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44968].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It's currently not possible to easily change the order in which you would like Stash Servers to be displayed on the "Where do you want to create the branch" dialog screen for Creating Branch in JIRA, especially when you have multiple Stash Servers. The screen only allows a maximum of 3 Stash Applications to be displayed at once, but allows you to scroll to find other hidden Stash Servers. Sometimes even the Primary Stash Server configured is hidden in the bottom of this list.

Problem is that the visibility of Servers that are at the bottom of the list and need to be scrolled to reach is quite low, so this becomes an inconvenience when your mostly used Stash Server is always hidden by default from the screen until you scroll to reach it.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement more intuitive arrangement order for Stash Servers in the "Where do you want to create the branch" dialog screen.
* One way to do this is to allow the Stash Servers to appear in the same order set in the Application Navigator.
fields.summary: Arrangement order for Stash Servers in where do you want to create the branch dialog

  {panel}

h5. Problem definition
In the history activity, recent changes show as a very ill-defined time of "3 hours ago" or "yesterday" instead of the actual time it was done.
The ones further in the past have a datetime for the change, but not recent ones, this is extremely irritating because I use this to find out when I made a change so I can figure out how much work to log.

h5. Suggested Solution
Show the complete timestamp for all changes, including the most recent.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44962].
  {panel}

When you have more than 1 favorite dashboards, their names are listed in a sidebar that steals a whole bunch of useful space from your dashboard. This waste of space is even more painful if you use  your screen vertically.

Two options to solve this:
* Add a undock button like you did for the brand new 6.0 issue navigator
* Give an option to completely hide the sidebar, since you can access your different dashboards from the pulldown menu (the sidebar is redundant with the menu and not really needed).

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Installing JIRA Agile & JIRA Service Desk together results in a red Javascript error being presented in Manage Boards & Rapid Board view.

h3. Environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44952].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

As of JIRA 7, support for Internet Explorer 9 has [been end-of-lifed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/End+of+Support+Announcements+for+JIRA#EndofSupportAnnouncementsforJIRA-201502IE9], however users using IE9 do not receive a notification indicating that their browser is unsupported. Similarly, users are unable to see any warning messages while using Jira versions which are incompatible with IE11.
 IE8 Users receive a popup message indicating that their browser is not supported however the link provided is invalid: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACloud/Supported+Platforms]
h3. Suggested Solution

Update the notification so that IE9 users are notified they are using an Unsupported Browser
 Update the notification to link to a valid article: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Supported+Platforms+for+Atlassian+Cloud+Applications]
h3. Workaround

none
fields.summary: Update Unsupported Browser Notification to Include Internet Explorer 9, 11

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44945].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Confluence's external macros from JIRA and JIRA Agile aren't working (existing ones) and if new ones are added to Confluence pages they're unable to retrieve JIRA's projects and saved filter, a required step of their configuration, which leads to the following error upon an attempt to save it: {color:red}No project or filter specified.{color}
Macros such as _Issue Statistics_ and _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics_.

h3. *Update*
Confluence is having trouble contacting JIRA whenever an action to fetch JIRA information is required.
In case the user wants to create an issue in JIRA using Confluence quick issue creation, he/she won't be able to browse the Projects available on JIRA due to a problem with the applink.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have JIRA and Confluence Cloud on the same instance
# On a Confluence page add the _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics_ macro
# Search for the JIRA's project or saved filter

h3. Expected Results
A drop-down list of available JIRA project or saved filter should appear according to what was typed

h3. Actual Results
No drop-down list appear and the following error is displayed when the current setting is saved: {color:red}No project or filter specified.{color}
 
h3. Notes
(i) This seems to be affecting JIRA gadgets as well.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Dragon Slayer documentation - specifically Stage 6, Step 2 - has been updated to refer to the latest version of the JIRA interface (6.4.10), however the Dragon Slayer documentation states in Stage 1 that you must use JIRA 6.3.15.

h3. Expected Results
The documentation should either be completely updated to work with 6.4.10, or the updated content should be reverted to match 6.3.15.
fields.summary: The Dragon Slayer documentation is inconsistant
